abilities.name: Reactive Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon is reduced by 10 for each React Energy card attached to Aerodactyl (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Aerodactyl.

attacks.name: Speed Stroke
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Bound Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Aggron can't use Bound Crush.

attacks.name: Devolution Wave
attacks.text: Count the number of React Energy cards attached to Cradily and choose up to that number of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of those Pokémon, then have your opponent shuffle those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Reactive Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a React Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Delcatty.

abilities.name: Shadow Curse
abilities.text: If Gengar would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cursed Reaction
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If Gengar has any React Energy cards attached to it, put 4 damage counters instead.

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Golem. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from Golem.

attacks.name: Enraged Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Golem to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Ancient Shell
abilities.text: As long as you have Omanyte or Omastar in play, damage done to Kabutops by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Kabutops.

attacks.name: Extra Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Support Navigation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Lapras onto your Bench from your hand, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift Blow
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 20 damage for each React Energy card attached to Machamp.

abilities.name: Type Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Mew is the same type as that Pokémon (all if that Pokémon is more than 1 type) until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Mew is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Mew and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 50.

abilities.name: Stench
abilities.text: As long as Muk is your Active Pokémon, each player's Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Fan
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Shiftry from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose 1 of your Evolved Pokémon in play (excluding any Shiftry). Return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Reactive Beating
attacks.text: If Shiftry has any React Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Nectar Pod
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Victreebel is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sharp Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Reactive Lift
abilities.text: As long as Wailord has any React Energy cards attached to it, the Retreat Cost for each of your Water Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) is 0.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rely on Friends
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Stage 1 Evolved Pokémon.

abilities.name: Shining Horn
abilities.text: As long as Absol is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Extra Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon-ex, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Rear Sensor
abilities.text: Each player's Active Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards on either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order you like.

attacks.name: Disorder
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Reactive Booster
abilities.text: Each React Energy card attached to all of your Huntail and Gorebyss provides 2 Energy of every type but has no effect other than providing Energy.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Gorebyss but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Reactive Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Huntail has no React Energy cards attached to it, you may search your deck for a React Energy card and attach it to Huntail. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Huntail is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Lanturn has any Water Energy attached to it, Lanturn is both Water and Lightning type.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more then 40 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Sol Shade
abilities.text: As long as you have Solrock in play, each player's Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Moon Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card (excluding Supporter cards), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Magmar is an Evolved Pokémon, all Energy attached to Magmar are Fire Energy instead of their usual types.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Burning Sensation
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

abilities.name: Reactive Recharge
abilities.text: If Magneton would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move any number of React Energy cards from Magneton to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Multiple Force
attacks.text: If Magneton has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Magnemite and Magneton (both yours and your opponent's) in play.

abilities.name: Ancient Fang
abilities.text: As long as you have Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex in play, Omastar's attacks do 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

abilities.name: Shining Horn
abilities.text: As long as Pinsir is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Luna Shade
abilities.text: As long as you have Lunatone in play, each player's Colorless Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lunatone and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Pattern Distraction
abilities.text: As long as Spinda is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent's Basic Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. You can't use more than 1 Pattern Distraction Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Whimsy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Spinda does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Torkoal.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Wobbuffet is an Evolved Pokémon, your opponent pays Colorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Wobbuffet.

attacks.name: Shadow Tag
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Influence
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Lileep, or Anorith and put up to 2 of them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stretch Claws
attacks.text: If Anorith has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Cascoon is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Cascoon and put it onto Cascoon. (This counts as evolving Cascoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Cascoon is affected by a Special Condition.

abilities.name: Deadlock
abilities.text: As long as Dunsparce is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Dunsparce can't attack.

attacks.name: Down Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards from the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Tripping Turn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. You may switch Dunsparce with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Body Slam

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more for each of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.text: Any damage done to Graveler by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, remove the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Ancient Protection
abilities.text: Each of your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, and Kabutops ex has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Reactive Colors
abilities.text: If Kecleon has any React Energy cards attached to it, Kecleon is Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 5 damage counters (all if there are less than 5) from Lairon. Lairon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Paranoid
abilities.text: As long as Machoke is Confused, Machoke's attacks do 50 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Split Kick
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Deep Sleep
abilities.text: As long as Misdreavus is your Active Pokémon, each player flips 2 coins for his or her Pokémon that is Asleep between turns. If either coin is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Return Trance
attacks.text: Return an Energy card attached to Misdreavus to your hand. The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Reactive Aroma
abilities.text: As long as Roselia has any React Energy cards attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that has any React Energy cards attached to it between turns. You can't use more than 1 Reactive Aroma Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Flick Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Power Circulation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. If you do, put 1 damage counter on Sealeo. This power can't be used if Sealeo is affected by a Special Condition.

abilities.name: Reactive Healing
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a React Energy card from your hand to Tangela, remove all damage counters from Tangela.

attacks.name: Entangling Vines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Reactive Shield
abilities.text: As long as Tentacruel has any React Energy cards attached to it, prevent all effects, including damage, done to any of your Tentacruel in play by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: If Vibrava has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to Aron.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Clamperl during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Geodude does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Grimer and put it onto Grimer. (This counts as evolving Grimer.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.text: If Lileep has any React Energy cards attached to it, remove 2 damage counters from Lileep.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby) and remove all damage counters from Magby.

attacks.name: Ignite
attacks.text: If Full Flame is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Magnetic Swirl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.text: Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Wurmple is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Wurmple is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: String Pull
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut) and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Wynaut and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

name: Cursed Stone
rules: At any time between turns, each player puts 1 damage counter on his or her Pokémon that has a Poké-Power.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Fieldworker
rules: Draw 3 cards. Your opponent may also draw a card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Full Flame
rules: Put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on each Burned Pokémon between turns. The Special Condition Burned can't be removed by evolving or devolving the Burned Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Giant Stump
rules: Each player can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon.When Giant Stump comes into play, each player discards Benched Pokémon and any cards attached to them until he or she has 3 Benched Pokémon. (You discard your Pokémon first.)
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Power Tree
rules: Once during each player's turn, if the player has no Special Energy cards in his or her discard pile, that player searches his or her discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to the opponent, and put it into his or her hand.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Strange Cave
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put an Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Aerodactyl ex, Lileep, or Anorith onto his or her Bench from his or her hand. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Claw Fossil

abilities.name: Jagged Stone
abilities.text: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Root Fossil

abilities.name: Spongy Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil. Illustrated by Ryo Ueda

rules: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fire Remedy
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Fire Energy from your hand to Arcanine ex, remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from Arcanine ex.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flame Swirl
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy or 1 React Energy card attached to Arcanine ex.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Armaldo ex has any React Energy cards attached to it, Armaldo ex is both Grass and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Armaldo ex.

attacks.name: Vortex Chop
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Resistance, this attack's base damage is 100 instead of 70.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Banette ex is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from either player's Pokémon to another Pokémon (yours or your opponent's). This power can't be used if Banette ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Chant
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dustox ex by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Emerge Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Flygon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Flygon ex.

attacks.name: Reactive Blast
attacks.text: You may discard any number of React Energy cards attached to Flygon ex. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: Mew ex can use the attacks of all Pokémon in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Power Move
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to Mew ex. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, you may switch Mew ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Icy Aura
abilities.text: As long as Walrein ex is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns, excluding Water Pokémon.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Final Blizzard

attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Regirock Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, this attack's base damage is 100 instead of 30.

attacks.name: Final Laser
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Registeel Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, put 6 damage counters instead.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
